Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Inputs: 1. Mary (AP Clerk): Receives invoice -> Checks PO existence. No PO -> Return to supplier. PO exists -> Log in system -> Forward to Purchasing (Dan) for receipt confirmation. Get confirmation -> Match invoice vs PO. Match? Yes -> Send to Manager. No -> Email Purchasing to clarify. If unresolved -> Escalate to Supervisor. Issue resolved & Manager approves -> Schedule payment. 2. Dan (Purchasing Officer): Receives invoice from AP -> Compare details (qty, price) with PO. Issues? -> Contact supplier or ask AP to hold for corrected version. Correct? -> Send confirmation email to AP. Missing PO? -> Tell Mary to get info. (Note: He assumes Mary moves it to manager after his confirmation). 3. Carlos (Dept Manager): Receives notification after match & Dans confirmation -> Reviews details. Good? -> Approve. Suspicious/Issues? -> Reject or ask AP to hold/investigate. Approve -> Goes to AP for payment. 4. Rita (AP Supervisor): Handles escalations/exceptions. Mary cant match/unresolved discrepancy -> Escalate to Rita. Rita contacts supplier/coordinating. No PO (informal services) -> Create retrospective PO or reject. Exception cleared -> Back to normal flow (Purchasing confirmation -> Manager approval -> Scheduling). 5. Karen (Supplier Relationship Mgr): Involved if mismatch/no PO. Helps contact supplier for info/revised invoice. Checks contracts for pricing disputes. Doesnt approve directly.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Synthesis & Process Flow Construction: Start Event: Invoice Received (by AP Clerk). Task 1: Check for PO Number (AP Clerk). Gateway 1 (XOR): Is PO valid/present? No: Return to Supplier for details (AP Clerk/Supplier). Note: Karen might be involved here if issues persist, but Mary initiates. -> Loop back to start? Or just wait. Lets say Request Supplier Action. Yes: Log Invoice in System (AP Clerk). Task 2: Forward to Purchasing / Request Receipt Confirmation (AP Clerk). Task 3: Verify Goods/Services Receipt & Match Details (Purchasing Officer). Note: Dan mentions checking PO details. Mary mentions getting confirmation. Lets group this as Purchasing Verification. Gateway 2 (XOR): Is there a Discrepancy? Yes (Discrepancy found): Sub-process/Task: Resolve Discrepancy. Actions: Contact Supplier (Karen/Purchasing), Check Contracts (Karen), Clarify with AP (Dan/Mary), Hold Invoice. Escalation: If unresolved, Escalate to Supervisor (Rita). Supervisor Action: Retrospective PO or Reject or Coordinate. Outcome: Discrepancy Resolved -> Loop back to Verification or proceed to next step? Mary says Once all issues are resolved... send to manager. Dan says Send confirmation. Lets assume a loop until resolved, then proceed. No (Match confirmed): Send Confirmation (Purchasing Officer). Task 4: Match Invoice to PO (AP Clerk). Mary mentions matching after getting confirmation. Dan compares too. Lets align: Dan confirms receipt/details, Mary performs system match. Gateway 3 (XOR - Implicit or Explicit): Match Successful? Yes: Send for Approval (AP Clerk). No: (Covered in Discrepancy path above). Task 5: Review & Approve Invoice (Department Manager). Gateway 4 (XOR): Approval Decision? Approve: Process moves to payment. Reject/Hold: Return to AP for investigation (AP Clerk). Task 6: Schedule Payment (AP Clerk). End Event: Payment Scheduled.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Refining the Flow & Roles: Participants (Lanes): 1. Accounts Payable (Mary, Rita) 2. Purchasing (Dan) 3. Management (Carlos) 4. Supplier Relations (Karen) - Optional, but useful for exception handling.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Handling Exceptions/Variations: Missing PO: Mary returns to supplier. Karen might help. Discrepancy (Price/Qty): Dan/Mary identify. Resolution involves Dan/Karen/Rita. Informal Services (No PO): Rita handles (Retrospective PO).

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Drafting the BPMN-like Textual Model: Pools/Lanes: Accounts Payable, Purchasing, Department Manager, Supplier Relations (for exceptions). Sequence: 1. Start: Invoice Received (AP). 2. Task: Validate PO Presence (AP). 3. Gateway: PO Present? No: Task: Request Supplier Correction/Details (AP/Supplier Relations). -> Loop back to Start/Validation? (Mary says send it back... requesting more details). Lets model this as a termination or return path. Lets assume it ends that instance and a new one starts later, or its an interrupting loop. Best practice: Loop back to Validate PO Presence after supplier acts. Yes: Task: Log Invoice (AP). 4. Task: Request Goods Receipt Confirmation (AP -> Purchasing). 5. Task: Verify Receipt & Match Order Details (Purchasing). 6. Gateway: Details Match? No (Discrepancy): Task: Investigate Discrepancy (Purchasing/AP). Task: Contact Supplier / Check Contract (Supplier Relations). Gateway: Resolved? No: Task: Escalate to Supervisor (AP Supervisor). Task: Handle Exception (AP Supervisor - e.g., Create Retro PO). -> Loop back to Purchasing Verification? Yes: Proceed to Confirmation. Yes: Task: Send Confirmation (Purchasing -> AP). 7. Task: Perform System Match (AP). Mary mentions matching after confirmation. 8. Task: Request Manager Approval (AP -> Manager). 9. Task: Review Invoice (Manager). 10. Gateway: Approve? No: Task: Hold/Investigate (AP). -> Loop back? Yes: Task: Approve Invoice (Manager). 11. Task: Schedule Payment (AP). 12. End.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Consolidating Conflicts: Mary matches after Dan confirms. Dan compares before confirming. This is sequential. Mary sends to Dan -> Dan checks -> Dan confirms -> Mary matches system -> Mary sends to Manager. Rita (Supervisor) handles No PO for informal services. Mary sends back to supplier if no PO. Rita says Sometimes we have invoices that dont match any PO... create a retrospective PO. This is an alternative path for No PO found in system but valid service.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Final Polish of the Structure: Roles: Accounts Payable (AP) Purchasing (Purchasing Officer) Department Manager (Manager) Supplier Relations (SRM) - Supporting role AP Supervisor - Exception handling Artifacts: Invoice, PO, Receipt Confirmation, Contract. Lets structure the output clearly. Section 1: Participants & Roles Section 2: Data Objects/Artifacts Section 3: Process Flow (The Model)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Detailed Flow Logic: 1. Start Event: Invoice Received by AP. 2. Task (AP): Validate PO Number. Output: Invoice status. 3. Gateway (XOR): PO Exists? Path A (No PO): Task (AP/SRM): Request Supplier Details / Correction. Task (AP Supervisor - Exception): If valid but missing PO (informal service), Create Retrospective PO. (Loop back to Validate PO Number or Log Invoice depending on outcome). Path B (PO Exists): Task (AP): Log Invoice in System. Task (AP): Forward to Purchasing for Verification. 4. Task (Purchasing): Verify Receipt & Compare Details (vs PO). Output: Verification Status. 5. Gateway (XOR): Is there a Discrepancy? Path A (Discrepancy): Task (Purchasing/SRM): Investigate / Contact Supplier. Gateway (XOR): Resolved? No: Task (AP Supervisor): Escalate & Resolve (Coordinate/Retro PO/Reject). Yes: Proceed. (Flow joins back to Main Path). Path B (No Discrepancy): Task (Purchasing): Send Confirmation to AP. 6. Task (AP): Match Invoice to PO in System. Note: Mary implies this happens after confirmation. 7. Task (AP): Submit for Manager Approval. 8. Task (Manager): Review Invoice & Budget. 9. Gateway (XOR): Approve? No: Task (AP): Hold & Investigate. (Potential loop back to Purchasing or Escalation). Yes: Task (Manager): Approve in System. 10. Task (AP): Schedule Payment. 11. End Event: Invoice Scheduled for Payment.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Ambiguities to note: The exact trigger for the Retrospective PO (Ritas interview) vs Send back to supplier (Marys interview). Mary says send back, Rita says create retro PO. The model should reflect Ritas intervention as an escalation path for valid non-PO invoices. The exact interaction between Dan and Mary regarding the System Match. Dan checks manually, Mary checks in system. The model will show Dans check first, then Marys system update.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Structure: Swimlanes: Accounts Payable, Purchasing, Management, Exceptions/Support (Supervisor/SRM). Start/End Flow Objects: Tasks, Gateways. Lets write itout.
